Nivel de diálogo del comité.
Nivel de apoyo al sector Justicia, el Ministerio Público y la CNRR.

comment.narrative:
No existen una estrategia conjunta de intervención común en materia de Justicia Internacional por parte de la Cooperación Internacional.
Los mecanismos de acceso de las víctimas a la justicia son débiles.
Las instituciones nacionales para el fortalecimiento de programas de protección y seguridad a víctimas y testigos, requieren apoyo.
Existe un diagnostico de necesidades de las instituciones del sector justicia.

1. Es elaborado y presentado un informe de recomendaciones para un potencial cambio en el sector de la política criminal y penitenciaria en el país en el marco del Acuerdo entre las FARC y Gobierno Nacional.
2. 3.000 víctimas logran su inclusión en el Registro Único de Victimas gracias al desarrollo de jornadas de atención descentralizadas.
3. 250 funcionarios públicos del país tienen acceso al protocolo de entrevista a víctimas de violencia sexual para mejorar la atención y evitar la victimización secundaria.
4. 3.000 víctimas avanzan en el proceso de reparación integral con su participación en incidentes de reparación integral y brigadas previas a los incidentes.

1. Fue elaborado y presentado un informe de recomendaciones para un potencial cambio en el sector de la política criminal y penitenciaria en el país en el marco del Acuerdo entre las FARC y Gobierno Nacional.
2. Con el fortalecimiento de la capacidad de respuesta del Ministerio Público se logró la toma de declaraciones de 3.096 víctimas que aún no se encontraban registradas en el RUV, permitiendo así que sean analizados y validados sus casos para ingresar en la ruta de atención y reparación integral.
3. En total 130 funcionarios públicos recibieron asistencia técnica para la aplicación de entrevistas a víctimas de violencia, así mismo fueron distribuidos entre actores clave 1.000 ejemplares del protocolo de entrevista a víctimas de violencia sexual.
4. Las acciones desarrolladas por el Fondo con El Ministerio de Justicia y el Ministerio Público, contribuyeron a la garantía del Derecho a la Justicia de 1.909 víctimas en desarrollo de etapas procesales y jornadas de denuncia. Un total de 1.315 víctimas fueron apoyadas en el marco de procesos judiciales de la Ley 975 de Justicia y Paz y 594 víctimas de violencia sexual apoyadas en procesos de denuncia ante las instituciones competentes. El número de víctimas de violencia sexual que han sido apoyadas en este periodo (594) corresponde al 4.9% del total de víctimas registradas por hechos relacionados con Delitos contra la libertad y la integridad sexual en el RUV.

1. 75.992 víctimas del conflicto armado disponen de mecanismos de justicia transicional que contribuyen al goce efectivo de sus derechos y a la resolución y transformación de conflictos sociales.
2. 51.962 victimas étnicas serán reparadas integralmente de acuerdo con sus derechos colectivos, priorizando la reparación colectiva, la protección del territorio y la restitución de tierras, a través de 5 de documentos de caracterización del daño al territorio de comunidades étnicas formulados, 8 demandas de restitución de tierras o medidas cautelares interpuestas para restitución o protección del territorio de los grupos étnicos y
3.Las víctimas del conflicto armado disponen de mecanismos de justicia transicional que contribuyen al goce efectivo de sus derechos y a la resolución y transformación de conflictos sociales

activity-description.narrative: Actividades realizadas en Bogotá - Sede APC

description.narrative: 1.Posicionamiento de la Agenda de Cooperación Internacional en el ámbito nacional e internacional 2.Recursos gestionados en cooperación internacional por la APC Colombia alcanzan los USD 1.000 millones de dólares. 3.Se cuenta con un documento de análisis y definición de criterios para el fortalecimiento del sistema de información de cooperación internacional. 4.Adaptación de la metodología ART en 8 departamentos del país.

comment.narrative: No existe.

Gestionar y hacer seguimiento a la Cooperación del sector privado, ONGS, y Fundaciones internacionales que recibe Colombia Trabajar de manera articulada con los responsables de fuentes bilaterales y multilaterales en la Dirección de Demanda, en la identificación de nuevas fuentes de cooperación (sector privado internacional, ONG´s Internacionales, Iglesias) en los respectivos países. Aprobar e implementar estrategia para abordar y gestionar la cooperación de los diferentes actores del sector privado, Iglesias y ONG´s que trabajan en Colombia. Apoyar en las actividades relacionadas con una estrategia de monitoreo y seguimiento a la Cooperación Internacional con nuevas fuentes

En la dinamización de la cooperación internacional se obtuvieron logros en el acercamiento al sector privado, a través del ajuste a la metodología de trabajo con Fuentes No Oficiales bajo una óptica de alianzas estratégicas, conforme a la Hoja de Ruta de la Cooperación Internacional 2015-2018. Adicionalmente el proyecto contribuyó a la implementación de mecanismos creados para el manejo de donaciones, tales como los convenios de asociación celebrados con entidades sin ánimo de lucro establecidas en el país. En el último año, APC-Colombia ha logrado canalizar donaciones por cerca de $470 millones de pesos, las cuales han sido entregadas a beneficiarios de todas las regiones del país que hacen parte de la población vulnerable.

comment.narrative: Para el período 2002-2008, el total de ingresos de regalías directas giradas ascendieron a $19,61 billones, lo cual significó un incremento del 143%. Producto de las explotaciones de hidrocarburos, carbón, níquel y otros minerales se giraron $16.3, $2.4, $0.58 y $0.33 billones respectivamente. Si bien en términos absolutos hubo un crecimiento considerable, la participación de los hidrocarburos en el total de regalías giradas disminuyó alrededor de 6 puntos porcentuales, en comparación de un aumento de la participación del carbón y níquel del 4.7 y 2.3 puntos porcentuales, respectivamente.

- 70% de las entidades territoriales - 100% de las entidades territoriales que agrupan el 95% de los recursos de regalías - 100% de las entidades territoriales que agrupan el 95% de los recursos de regalías

- Seguimiento a 411 planes de mejora de proyectos visitados en este período que representan el 53% de los proyectos visitados (visitas individuales e integrales) por valor de $2,8 billones - 100% de las entidades cuentan con información actualizada debido a la publiación mensual de informes en la página web del Sistema General de Regalías sobre el estado de aprobación y avance en la ejecución de los proyectos financiados. - 22 departamentos cuentan con herramientas herramientas teóricas y prácticas necesarias para realizar control social a los recursos del SGR, gracias a 56 jornadas de capacitación a diferentes actores de la sociedad civil, con la participación de 1380 participantes.
N/A

A diciembre de 2016, 6 entidades territoriales están sujetas a condiciones especiales de seguimiento y giro, a 57 entidades se les ha autorizado el levantamiento de la medida de suspensión de giro de regalías y 153 entidades continúan suspendidas.

description.narrative: Designing and Implementing a National Sub-System of Marine Protected Areas (SMPA) in Colombia

Promover la conservación y uso sostenible de la biodiversidad marina y costera en las regiones Pacífica y Caribe, a través del diseño e implementación de un Sistema de Areas Marinas Protegidas (SAMP) financieramente sostenible y bien manejado.
bay
Environment - policy, planning and administration

Área total (ha) bajo protección dentro del SAMP. Cambio en la representatividad ecológica de ecosistemas marinos y costeros clave en las AMPs. Cambio en el cubrimiento de los ecosistemas costero y marino claves dentro de siete (7) AMPs (PNN Gorgona, PNN Old Providence-McBean Lagoon, PNN Corales del Rosario y San Bernardo, PNN Sanquianga, DMI Bahía Cispatá, PNN Bahía Málaga y Bahía Portete – Las dos últimas serán nuevas áreas creadas durante el proyecto). Cambio en la riqueza de las especies de aves en seis (6) AMPs. Radio entre la tendencia de la Medida de Longitud de las Capturas (MLC) y la Medida de Longitud de la Madurez (MLM) para tres (3) especies marinas en tres (3) AMPs (PNN Gorgona , DMI Bahía Cispatá-Río Sinú, PNN Old Providence-McBean Lagoon) Incremento en la capacidad financiera del SAMP al medirlo a través del puntaje promedio total de todas las AMPs en la tarjeta de resultados del PNUD/FMAM. Existencia de un presupuesto nacional para la sostenibilidad del SAMP y sus AMPs asociadas, en línea con sus metas de conservación

Realizar los planes de manejo para las nuevas áreas declaradas. Establecer la estrategia de sostenibilidad financiera para el SAMP Consolidar los acuerdos de uso y manejo de la biodiversidad con población dentro y cercana a las AMP declaradas

Se cuenta con avances en la formulación de los planes de manejo del DRMI Golfo de Tribugá Cabo Corrientes, del PNN Bahía Portete, y del PNN Uramba-Bahia Málaga. En cuanto a la estrategía de sostenibilidad financiera, se han venido obteniendo insumos que se están consolidando para la construcción de la estrategia. Con relación a los acuerdos de uso y manejo de la biodiversidad, se ha concretado el acuerdo con mangleros en el DRMI Cispatá y con pescadores en el DRMI Golfo de Tribugá - Cabo Corrientes.

1.Marco regulatorio para el Sistema Nacional de Áreas Protegidas que incluye el Subsistema de Áreas Marinas Protegidas 2.Estrategia de cierre del proyecto consolidada integrando los componentes del proyecto con los objetivos y metas para las áreas marinas protegidas 3.Mecanismos necesarios desarrollados para mejorar la gestión, planificación , administración y sostenibilidad financiera del Subsistema de Áreas Marinas Protegidas, a través de las siguientes actividades: a) determinar la estructura administrativa y de gestión de la SMPA ; b ) definir el plan de acción del SAMP ; y c ) la definición del plan financiero para el funcionamiento y la gestión del SAMP. 4.Planes de majeo de las nuevas áreas marinas protegidas formulados. 5.Estrategia de sostenibilidad financiera del SAMP articulada, concertada y ajustada al plan de acción del SAMP. 6.Acuerdos establecidos con beneficiarios directos de la conservación marina estableciendo sus responsabilidades financieras con las AMP que contribuyen a disminuir la brecha financiera. 7.Metodología de deforestación evitada para REDD publicada y documento de proyecto estructurado para la iniciativa REDD + a implementar en el DRMI Cispatá 8.Soporte Inicial a la implementación del Plan de Manejo del DMI Cispatá 9.Plan de negocios de OLD POINT apoyado

1. Marco regulatorio para el Sistema Nacional de Áreas Protegidas que incluye el Subsistema de Áreas Marinas Protegidas En Abril de 2016 el Consejo Nacional de Áreas Protegidas (CONAP), indicó y formalizó mediante acta, que el SAMP es el mecanismo ideal para la armonización y manejo de las AMP en Colombia. Así mismo, se ha dado la gestión del convenio que consolide la instancia de coordinación del SAMP, mediante la articulación de los Subsistemas Regionales de Áreas Protegidas - SIRAP Caribe y Pacífico.
Se elaboró el documento que contiene el estado del arte, análisis de información y propuesta de criterios para la zonificación y la determinación de los usos que se pueden definir dentro de las áreas marinas protegidas, de acuerdo con las categorías definidas por la normativa vigente y teniendo en cuenta las características ambientales, socioculturales y económicos de las áreas marinas.
Finalmente, se realizó la propuesta de lineamientos para el co-manejo de las AMP regionales con la participación de las principales partes interesadas, la identificación de los mecanismos de coordinación y los roles en línea con la normatividad vigente.
2. Estrategia de cierre del proyecto consolidada integrando los componentes del proyecto con los objetivos y metas para las áreas marinas protegidas. En el marco de las actividades de cierre del proyecto, se consolidó la estrategia de cierre y sostenibilidad del proyecto que integra los cinco componentes y define los objetivos y metas para la operación, financiamiento y coordinación de las AMP; igualmente se realizó la documentación sobre lecciones aprendidas del proyecto. La estrategia de sostenibilidad tiene un horizonte de 5 años y una estructura financiera que permita su continuidad; identifica los roles y responsables frente a su sostenibilidad y una hoja de ruta que permitirá que los resultados del proyecto logren permanecer en el tiempo. 3. Mecanismos necesarios desarrollados para mejorar la gestión, planificación , adminis

Cierre operativo y financiero del proyecto que incluye preparación de los informes de terminación del proyecto como son el informe de calidad (“quality assurance”) y la herramienta de seguimiento para los proyectos de conservación de biodiversidad (“tracking tool”), respuesta de gerencia ("management response") a las observaciones y recomendaciones de la evaluación final del proyecto y definición de acciones para la implementación de los objetivos planteados en la estrategia de sostenibilidad construida por los socios del proyecto.

description.narrative: Existence of the SMPA as part of the SINAP

comment.narrative: No official SMPA
The SMPA is legally established

The SMPA is legally established
Decree regulating the National Protected Areas System SINAP initials in Spanish includes within it the creation of thematic subsystems that constitute a set of protected areas social and institutional actors management tools and instruments for its articulation looking for common conservation objectives and addressing specific logical drive From there the support of the SMPA arises from the existing regulatory framework of SINAP SMPA have legal basis making use of the existing regulatory framework for SINAP Within this regulation framework its created an organization that seeks to integrate management of the subsystems and for the discussions of policies and regulations of them The National council for protected areas CONAP initials in Spanish chaired by the Minister of Environment becomes the stage for generating reflections against the regulatory framework and give recognition to the SMPA through the integration of a delegate for it in the CONAP Having an action plan for the subsystem with a coordinating organization and a delegate to the CONAP will shape the SPMA within the existing regulatory framework and give legal backing to it
Inclusion of the SMPA as part of this Decree was approved within the Management Response
The conceptualization of the SMPA in Colombia document was also published Currently SMPA is articulated with the action plans of the Caribbean and Pacific Regional Protected Areas Systems SIRAPs initials in Spanish

comment.narrative: La demanda de energía crecerá cerca de 80 TWh para el 2020
Adopción de norma de reglamentación técnica RETIQ Estrategia de sensibilización y comunicación a sectores para la entrada en vigor de la norma

Expedición del Reglamento Técnico de Etiquetado 18 de Sep 2015. Se implementa a partir del 31 de agosto de 2016, para ello se cuenta con una estrategia de comunicación y sensibilización a todos los actores del proyecto.

Reducción de las emisiones directas (acumuladas en el período de 2011-2015): 1309 ktCO2 Reducción de las emisiones indirectas (acumuladas en el período de 2016-2025): 9,511 ktCO2 Ahorro de energía anual, debido a aparatos EE: 11,4 TWh 2025 (de los cuales 60% se puede atribuir al proyecto). Más detalles del cálculo se presentan en el Anexo C del documento de proyecto.

Debido a la expedición del reglamento en 2015, no se cuenta con elementos de impacto para el calculo de las emisiones del periodo comprendido entre 2011-2015. Reducción de las emisiones indirectas es una proyección (acumuladas en el período de 2016-2025): 9,511 ktCO2, Ahorro de energía anual, debido a aparatos EE: 11,4 TWh 2025 (de los cuales 60% se puede atribuir al proyecto)

description.narrative: To reduce CO2 emissions through the implementation of a mandatory energy efficiency standards and labels program
a Change in annual sales towards average higher efficiency appliances lower unit energy consumption UEC

comment.narrative: According to unit energy consumption UEC table in Prodoc

Reduction in average UEC see table in Prodoc of selected household appliances refrigerators refrigeratorfreezers and freezers lamps ballasts water heaters air conditioning equipment and washing machines and electric motors
According to the Ministry of Mines and Energy the Regulations will be issued during 2015

description.narrative: b Share of noncompliant products in mandatory SL

comment.narrative: NA there is no mandatory SL
Measured as part of surveys of component 2 at the end of the project

The issuance of the Technical Regulations RETIQ on standardization and labelling for energy enduse equipment has been delayed for reasons beyond the control of the project and the executing agency preventing us from measuring the progress on this indicator This indicator shall be measured at the end of the project

description.narrative: c Energy consumption trend

comment.narrative: Annual energy demand will increase to about 80 TWh by 2020

With URE Governments policy on rational use of energy annual power demand in Colombia is expected to stabilize at around 50 TWh implying savings of 30 TWh out of which 67 TWh of savings can be attributed to the use of more EE appliances
Of the 67 TWh savings 60 4 TWh is expected due to the direct and indirect impact of this project s intervention

UPME performs an energy balance every year in various sectors The adjusted figure for energy consumption was 57614 GWh in 2013 Residential 21293 GWh industrial 19685 GWh commercial 14830 GWh and other 1806 The energy balance will not be the only tool used to monitor this indicator it shall be supplemented by a strategy to measure the specific impact of equipment labelling However it is important to note that equipment labelling has no impact on the countrys energy consumption as the Technical Regulations are yet to be issued This indicator will be monitored once the Technical Regulations are released

description.narrative: d Amount of CO2 avoided in comparison with baseline level

comment.narrative: CO2 emissions will rise in accordance with energy consumption see project objective indicator c

Direct emissions reduction cumulative over period 201120151309 ktCO2
Indirect emissions reduction cumulative 20162025 9511 ktCO2
Annual energy savings due to EE appliances 114 TWh 2025 of which 60 can be attributed to the project

The estimate for total reduction by the year 2025 is about 4 million tons of CO2 which amounts to 66 of total emissions due to energy consumption in the residential and commercial sectors in Colombia This reduction which corresponds to nearly 2 of the total emissions of the energy industry according to the National Emissions Inventory INGEI will be mainly achieved through the implementation of the Regulations in commercial and domestic refrigeration equipment gas heaters gas appliances and air conditioning equipment This baseline is defined in the study that the project conducted during the reporting period Current Market Structure May 2015 This evaluation established that the implementation of the RETIQ brings an environmental benefit to society and promotes the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions in the period defined by the study 20152025 compared to a scenario without RETIQ This reduction is mainly due to the energy consumption related to energy enduse equipment

description.narrative: Consolidated information on the market structure and established market transformation strategy with defined instruments and procedures
f Level of information available to define energy consumption in label categories and for measuring project impact

comment.narrative: Data available at UPMEs database but needs to be updated and expanded CM YA SE TIENE LA LINEA BASE
Upgraded database and regularly updated data on annual sale of different appliances per energy classes A to G available for public use with finalized market monitoring methodology

The information on the structure of the national market for equipment subject to the RETIQ project was updated and consolidated There was also an assessment of the behaviour of the market in the face of the inclusion of mandatory labelling of energy efficiency parameters May 2015 The study considered variables such as existing equipment and equipment currently being used in Colombian households replaced equipment produced equipment imported equipment exported equipment equipment sales annual energy consumption associated to existing equipment equipment prices Thus the National Government has a diagnosis of the current market and its analysis on projected sales through a model that determined the impact the RETIQ would have if it comes into effect This study has made a great contribution to the country by providing a current picture of market behaviour and an indepth analysis on the areas that must be strengthened in order to achieve a positive transformation of the market where energy efficiency is considered as a variable in purchasing decisions One of the main conclusions of the study is the need to work and direct efforts toward training the sales force who directly influence purchasing decisions of Colombian consumers Their current training and information level is very poor there is work being done alongside the industry ANDI to start providing this training to the sales staff of companies

description.narrative: g Status of recommendations contributing to institutional sustainability transformation strategy

comment.narrative: SL system in place is voluntary but has limited impact so far
Market transformation strategy enhanced for implementation of mandatory SL programs procedures and organizational arrangements including testing and enforcement with a budgeted implementation plan

There have been 12 interinstitutional meetings Ministry of Commerce Ministry of Environment Superintendence of Industry and Commerce SENA Confecámaras ANDI FENALCO Asodelco ANDESCO ACAIRE Corpotrece Additionally there was 1 workshop to disclose the results of the study on the current market for equipment 37 participants The purpose of this workshop was to follow up on the commitment of public and private authorities regarding the implementation of the Regulations as part of a comprehensive strategy for institutional sustainability As a result of these meetings each entity took ownership of the labelling process and a communication strategy for Labelling in Colombia was established bringing together the efforts made by various public and private entities on the subject

description.narrative: Consumer and industry engagement strategy developed and implemented
i Priority of different criteria used by customers in their purchasing decision

comment.narrative: No emphasis among the consumers and sales personnel on energy efficiency aspects and life cycle costs when purchasing and marketing new appliances
Beside the initial purchasing price energy efficiency and lifecycle costs have become a key criteria for purchasing decisions guided by the energy label

The project still has its web page currently at wwwetiquetaenergeticagovco now integrated to UPMEs server with the purpose of providing information related to the energy label The web page is expected to help end consumers understand how their purchasing decisions influence energy consumption and climate change The page also contains with access to the general public Training Modules 4 Modules an educational and learning support material developed by the project February 2015 These modules also serve as input for SENA in formulating curricular plans for nationwide implementation through onsite or online courses The web page currently shows an increase of 73 in the number of new users Moreover the project designed a communication strategy to support the dissemination and promotion of labelling which included the participation of 14 strategic allies This strategy crosssectionally supports every component of the project in order to establish mutually beneficial relations with public and private actors toward the dissemination of information regarding labelling This is done by providing new communication settings and channels different from those obtained through procurement as well as generating public opinion and a discussion on the subject of the project and gathering materials or contents that support or reinforce the messages already designed In this way the strategic allies ANDI FENALCO Ministry of Commerce Ministry of Environment Ministry of Mines and Energy Confecámaras Andesco Asodelco Corpotrece SENA SIC ONAC INM ICONTEC are committed to supporting the activities for training dissemination advertising and generation of content through their own channels This aims at the appropriation and adequate response to the matter from a communication approach that can have regional and national impact

description.narrative: Enhanced capacities of key public and private agencies
e Status of programs in key public agencies to implement effective mandatory SL

comment.narrative: Insufficient implementation of SL program which is voluntary only
New policy provisions and compliance checking enforcement and outreach programs adopted for mandatory SL that reflect international œbest practices

This project contributed to the implementation of energy efficiency measures identified through 19 regional workshops 163 people and 2 virtual workshops 53 people amounting to a total of 216 officials trained during this year giving a boost to the growth of the institutional capacity to meet the labelling requirements once the Regulations come into effect Moreover the training modules that were carried out as part of the project February 2015 have been included by the SENA as a strategic ally as inputs for the curricular design of the training course Energy Efficiency Labelling The modules have been very important for training and will continue to take place throughout 20152016 Additionally the project made a diagnosis of the National Quality Subsystem SNCA the instance for promoting markets through quality and productivity by coordinating activities between public and private organizations for the standardization technical regulations accreditation compliance and metrology assessment In this way we identified the strengths and weaknesses of these organizations for the implementation of the Regulations The suggested Regulations were disclosed in 2 meetings with the SNCA entities with the attendance of 28 public officials There was an assessment on the capacity of the countrys laboratories to meet the demand for testing once the Regulations are issued concluding that the country has a group of laboratories competent enough in the shortterm to carry out energy efficiency tests on refrigerators 7 laboratories and gas appliances 7 laboratories Currently there are not any laboratories that can perform tests on washing machines but it was found that there are 2 laboratories with a high potential for carrying out the aforementioned tests or trials in the shortterm As for air conditioners there is only one laboratory with a high potential for carrying out the tests These conclusions and other related to the demand for future testing once the Regulations are issued are included in the study which significantly contributed to the strategic lines in order to strengthen not only the network of laboratories in the country but also the SNCA as a whole
These results were made public through 3 workshops for 107 people Additionally the project took part in the World Metrology Day with a presentation about Labelling Regulations and their relationship with the SNCA and metrology May 20th 2015 50 people attended this workshop

description.narrative: Monitoring and evaluation the for project and EE SL program carried out
j The level of information available for monitoring and evaluation and adaptive management

comment.narrative: NA
Adequate information available for monitoring evaluation and for measuring project results

The project has an operating and decisionmaking structure that allows us to disseminate information and results through different means Decisionmaking tasks are the responsibility of the Steering Committee which meets twice a year 112614 051915 to discuss and approve project activities Additionally a followup meeting is held quarterly with UNDP and the executing agency This allows continuous monitoring of project activities In addition the project Coordination Unit carries out a daily followup of all activities This year the first Project Financial Audit February 2015 took place which resulted in a Low Risk Rating given that the project management has properly strengthened its administrative procedures processes and policies

Decrees signed on Technical regulations making labels andor MEPs mandatory for electric motors and household appliances in the following order of priority refrigerators and freezers lighting ballasts room air conditioners water heaters and washing machines

Institutional strengthening the issuance of the regulations and the support to their implementation are sustainability standards As a result the Ministry of Mines and Energy the Ministry of Commerce and the Ministry of Environment are committed and will work together so that both the Technical Regulations and the associated processes are established as a national guideline for disseminating this policy

Este proyecto corresponde a la Etapa I del Plan de Manejo para la Eliminación del Consumo de Hidroclorofluorocarbonos (HCFC) en Colombia para el período 2011 – 2015
seat of a first-order administrative division

seat of a first-order administrative division
policy, planning and administration

Consumo de HCFC al valor de la línea base en el año 2013 y reducción del 10% del consumo de HCFC en Colombia en el año 2015 (a partir de la línea base correspondiente al promedio del consumo de los años 2009-2010)

comment.narrative: "El uso de HCFC en Colombia se ha incrementado desde la década de los 90 cuando se dio inicio al proceso de eliminación del consumo de los CFC. El HCFC-141b ha sido utilizado como el sustituto por excelencia del CFC-11 como agente soplante en la fabricación de espumas de poliuretano, el HCFC-123 ha reemplazado el Halon-1211 en el sector de extinción de incendios y el HCFC-22 es actualmente el gas refrigerante de mayor uso en el sector de refrigeración y aire acondicionado doméstico y refrigeración comercial, donde reemplazó al CFC-12. Colombia se ha comprometido a cumplir las obligaciones frente al Protocolo de Montreal buscando prevenir efectos adversos para la economía nacional, la industria y los consumidores. El gobierno ha diseñado una estrategia de dos etapas para cumplir las medidas de control para el consumo de los HCFC, una primera para afrontar el congelamiento de la línea base para el año 2013 y la reducción del 10% en el año 2015, y la segunda para eliminar completamente el uso de estas sustancias en el año 2030. Durante el período 2030 – 2040, se permitirá un consumo de HCFC equivalente al 2,5% de la línea base para el sector de mantenimiento de refrigeración y aire acondicionado. En el año 2015 el país revisará los avances de la implementación de la estrategia para analizar la posibilidad de establecer un cronograma de reducción más drástico"
Reducción del consumo en un 10% del valor de la línea base.
Se cumplió con la reducción del 10% del consumo de los HCFC a partir del 1 de enero de 2015
Reducción del consumo en un 10% del valor de la línea base.
Reducción del consumo en un 24. 04% del valor de la linea base

comment.narrative:
- No existe ningun plan sectorial de desarrollo bajo en carbono en ningun sector ·
- Algunos potenciales NAMAs han sido identificados en el sector transporte pero no tienen documentos de diseño.
- NAMAs deseables han sido presentados por Colombia ante la UNFCCC pero no existen acciones o estrategias para su implementación.
- Algunos programas de mitigación están en implementación en el sector agrícola (sistemas silvopastoriles)

Socialización y difusión de la ECDBC, PAS y cobeneficios.

comment.narrative: No existe línea de base
Diseño e implementación de la estrategia Alianzas estratégicas

• Mediante la alianza estratégica con PNUD, APC-Colombia logró diseñar un modelo de agregación de valor de la CSS, con el fin de ampliar el impacto de las actividades, proyectos y programas que se desarrollan en ese marco. • Así mismo, con el apoyo del PNUD, se inició el proceso de documentación de experiencias nacionales e internacionales en materia de construcción de la paz, como insumo para el diseño de estrategias e iniciativas que contribuyan a la implementación de los acuerdo de paz entre las FARC y el Gobierno Nacional. Dicho apoyo se dio principalmente a través de la transferencia de las 6 metodologías que componen la estrategia de documentación de la Agencia llamada “Saber hacer Colombia”. • También se inició la construcción de herramientas para el diseño, preparación, implementación, monitoreo y evaluación de las principales modalidades de intercambio de conocimiento de APC-Colombia.
Diseño e implementación de la estrategia Alianzas estratégicas

Durante 2016 se avanzó en la implementación de la estrategia a través de la sistematización de casos de construcción de paz a nivel nacional e internacional en el marco de Saber Hacer Colombia. En total se documentaron un total de 17 casos a nivel nacional. Se fortaleció la alianza con UNOSSC y con SSMART, con quienes se trabajó durante 2016 y se tiene contemplado continuar trabajando en 2017.

El proyecto pretende demostrar la viabilidad técnica, económica y ambiental de destruir Sustancias agotadoras de la Capa de Ozono-SAO a nivel nacional.
independent political entity
policy, planning and administration

Establecimiento de una alternativa sostenible, ambientalmente segura y económicamente viable para Colombia para destruir los residuos de SAO a través de la destrucción de 114 toneladas de residuos de SAO en forma demostrativa y piloto

comment.narrative: Como consecuencia de la implementación de los diferentes programas y proyectos promovidos y financiados por el Protocolo de Montreal y orientados a la disminución y eliminación del consumo de SAO, como los mencionados anteriormente; la reconversión voluntaria a tecnologías libres de SAO de grandes empresas y los controles realizados para la importación y el comercio de las SAO, se han presentado existencias de residuos de SAO y equipos con SAO que requieren disposición final. Las principales fuentes de estos residuos de SAO son: i) refrigerantes CFC, HCFC y HFC inutilizables provenientes de las actividades de reciclaje y regeneración; ii) existencias de CFC recuperados de los equipos retirados de las instalaciones de los usuarios finales; iii) existencias residuales de SAO (por lo general de CFC-11 y CFC-12) que quedan después de la eliminación gradual o la reconversión a tecnologías libres de SAO; iv) las reservas de CFC, HCFC o HFC que puedan existir en las empresas cerradas o en quiebra; y v) el material confiscado por las autoridades aduaneras.

- Mínimo 1 Tonelada de CFC-11 destruidas a nivel demostrativo - Mínimo 1 Toneladas de CFC-12 destruidas a nivel demostrativo - Mínimo 5 ton de espuma de poliuretano con SAO destruidas a nivel demostrativo - Mínimo 80 Toneladas de CFC-11 provenientes de espuma de poliuretano destruidas a nivel piloto - Proyecto de norma para reglamentar el tratamiento térmico - incineración de residuos de SAO con soporte técnico preparado 100% - Operación de RED VERDE con ocho (8) empresas participantes - Mínimo 28.000 refrigeradores domésticos con CFC gestionados - Mínimo 28.000 usuarios finales de refrigeradores domésticos con CFC sensibilizados.

Se realizaron las pruebas cortas de quemado en el horno rotatorio para determinar la concentración límite de cloro total a ser alimentada durante la segunda corrida de pruebas completas. Se incineraron 200 kilogramos de CFC-11.
0 Kg CFC-12 destruidas. La segunda parte de las pruebas de quemado no fue realizada durante el año 2015 debido a razones propias de la empresa relacionadas con la mejora del proceso de incineración para cumplir con los parámetros de operación y emisión.
0 Kg de espuma de poliuretano con SAO destruidas a nivel demostrativo. La segunda parte de las pruebas de quemado no fue realizada durante el año 2015 debido a razones propias de la empresa relacionadas con la mejora del proceso de incineración para cumplir con los parámetros de operación y emisión.
1.000 kilogramos de espuma de PU con CFC-11 compactados y almacenados para pruebas.
Proyecto de norma preparado pero pendiente de incluir aspectos puntuales obtenidos como resultados de las pruebas de quemado de SAO y PCB.
El programa posconsumo de neveras "RED VERDE", con ocho empresas participantes, operó durante todo el año en la ciudad de Bogotá y se realizaron campañas puntuales en la isla de San Andrés, Santa Rosa de Cabal y norte del Valle del Cauca.
1223 refrigeradores domésticos con CFC gestionados.
300 usuarios finales de refrigeradores domésticos con CFC sensibilizados
Nota aclaratoria. El día 18 de noviembre de 2015 se solicitó realizar una revisión final al Proyecto 83728 sobre destrucción de SAO. La razón por la cual se realizó esta revisión, se debió a que la empresa TECNIAMSA con la cual el MADS ha suscrito un acuerdo de colaboración por un valor máximo de US$300,000, no pudo desarrollar las segundas pruebas de quemado por razones técnicas relacionadas con el desempeño del horno incinerador, las cuales pueden afectar significativamente los resultados del proyecto, y por lo tanto fue necesario reprogramar las pruebas de quemado para el primer trimestre del año 2016.

Mínimo 1 ton de CFC-11 y 1 ton de CFC-12 almacenadas Mínimo 5 ton de espuma de poliuretano con CFC-11 almacenadas Mínimo 1 ton de CFC-11 y 1 ton de CFC-12 incineradas Mínimo 5 ton de espuma de poliuretano con CFC-11 incineradas Programa posconsumo de neveras operando en tres (3) ciudades Informe de la evaluación de alternativas para la gestión integral de espumas de poliuretano con las empresas DIACO, HOLCIM y DOW QUÍMICA

0,644 ton de CFC-11 y 1,476ton de CFC-12 almacenadas Mínimo 5,98 ton de espuma de poliuretano con CFC-11 almacenadas Mínimo 0,25 ton de CFC-11 y 0,16 ton de CFC-12 incineradas Mínimo 5,98 ton de espuma de poliuretano con CFC-11 incineradas Programa posconsumo de neveras operando en tres (3) ciudades (Bogotá, Medellin y Pereira) Suscripcion de cuerdo de colaboración comprende las actividades de evaluación de alternativas para la gestión integral de espumas de poliuretano con Red Verde.
Nota: las cantidades utilizadas en las pruebas piloto de destrucción variaron de acuerdo a la capacidad tecnica del horno comprobada mediente las pruebas de labratorio.

El valor acumulado es 451.1 MT eliminadas de formar segura y 585 MT almacendas (de las cuales 51 están en instalaciones de gestores autorizados y 534 en instalaciones de los propietarios. Se ha logrado eliminar una mayor cantidad lo que evita una mayor cantidad de almacenamiento.

description.narrative: To protect human health and the environment locally as well as globally arising from unsound PCB management in Colombia
Number of businesses that provide transportation storage or elimination of PCBs in accordance with national and international standards

comment.narrative: Currently there are six businesses in the country who provide storage and transportation services for PCBs there are none who carry out PCB elimination The businesses involved with PCB elimination must comply with national norms and international standards
6 Service providers storage packing and transport operating according to new guidelines

Three 3 service providers have been evaluated against the standards for storage packaging and transport of PCBs
Currently only one 1 company has three 3 secure warehouses that can operate according to standards

description.narrative: Number of companies implementing new regulatory guidelines

comment.narrative: A new PCB management base regulation has been passed No new guidelines PCB holders or service providers are in compliance with new guidelines
15 maintenance companies operating according to new guidelines

As of June 30 2015 a document summarizing best practices for maintenance activities is available
It includes an assessment of the operations and good practices from 20 companies 133 of the project target
All 20 companies participated in the preparation of these documents

description.narrative: Number of guidelines manuals established for PCB management

comment.narrative: In 2011 Colombia released the Resolution 222 through which the management and PCB elimination goals are managed in accordance to the requirements This norm requires that PCB owners and equipment which contains PCBs that is in use or disuse be marked Different methodologies have been developed at the national level to carry out PCB equipment marking and these methodologies must be compiled into a report The norm establishes measures for the adequate maintenance of the equipment and the avoidance of crosscontamination
4 guidelines manuals developed by end of the project

Up to June 30 2015 four 4 documents are available all currently undergoing a validation process by the sectors involved These are
Labeling guidelines
Maintenance guidelines
Manual for comprehensive PCB management
Guide for foreign trade authorities
During this reporting period the Manual for Comprehensive PCB Management has also been revised and has already undergone public consultation

description.narrative: Number of operators technicians and professionals trained in the adequate management of PCBs

comment.narrative: Training and capacity building is required for personnel who work for businesses involved in PCB management and for those in the electricity sector who have waste equipment with PCBs so that they may carry out their work in accordance with national and international standards
50 maintenance and other personnel at PCB holders trained in safe PCB handling

During the second half of 2015 under the framework of GRANT with CIDET three 3 validation workshops related to the compilation of good maintenance practices were held 70 people attended these workshops representing about 20 companies engaged in these activities

description.narrative: One 1 norm elaborated for thermal treatment

comment.narrative: Since 2013 the Ministry of Environment and Sustainable Development is elaborating a norm which regulates the thermal treatment of dangerous waste and requires that specific studies be elaborated to establish the treatment of other waste that is considered extremely toxic such as PCBs
One 1 norm approved for thermal treatment
A draft of the regulation of thermal treatment of hazardous waste was developed for the Ministry of Environment whom should include in its text PCB burn tests results

description.narrative: Persons from environmental health and comercial authorities trained and qualified in PCB management

comment.narrative: Environmental health and commerce authorities personnel do not have the knowledge and training to execute control and monitoring of the PCB stockpiles in the country
50 officials of the environmental health and commerce authorities trained to control the commerce storage transport treatment and final disposal of PCBs

Of a total of 13 workshops held since the projects start 6 workshops were held during the reporting period 2014 to 2015 during which 6 environmental authorities and 5 foreign trade authorities were trained
Of a total of 210 cumulative participants 93 participants were trained during the current reporting period
This number of participants is equal to 4 times the project target
Training workshops addressed technical aspects and regulations on storage transportation and proper PCB environmental disposal

description.narrative: Quantity of PCBs liquids and solids destroyed in the project period 20132017

comment.narrative: 1000 MT PCBs destroyed pre project through exports
Additional minimum of 600 MT of PCBs liquids and solids disposed of in an environmentally sound manner

To this date the project has resulted in the elimination of 4511 MT 752 of the target Of this quantity during the 20142015 reporting period 1041 MT was exported for disposal In addition during this reporting period 47 MT of non porous solid waste contaminated with PCBs were treated by using washing processes

description.narrative: Quantity tonnes of equipment and waste contaminated by PCBs that is stockpiled by the year immediately preceding the closure of the Colombia PCB inventory

comment.narrative: 400 MT PCB stockpiled
All known PCBs safely stockpiled
According to national inventory reports 585 MT of waste was stored From the total 5343 MT of waste are in the owners and 508 in authorized facilities

description.narrative: The indicator will measure how many demonstration projects have been developed within the project framework to treat or eliminate equipment and waste with PCBs in Colombia

comment.narrative: The country has no facilities for treatment or disposal of PCBs
At least two treatment and disposal alternatives in demonstrative pilot projects servicing PCB owners

In December 2014 the pilot project of installation and operation of the washing plant for equipment contaminated with PCB was completed The project was funded through a Partnership Agreement signed between project and LITO SAS
9 units contaminated with PCB with concentrations ranging from 58 ppm to 85000 ppm PCB were washed
In addition as part of the agreements signed between the project and CEMEX COLOMBIA SA and TECNIAMSA SA evaluations and ratings were completed and were selected the best two 2 facilities to conduct PCB burn tests one test burn for each company
Industrial safety evaluations were conducted to prepare test protocols and a company was hired to prepare the strategic communication management process to communities located near CEMEX facilities
During the period 20142015 the project prepared a project to finance the installation of a facility at semiindustrial scale for demonstrating the elimination of PCB

description.narrative: Development of national capacity for environmentally sound management and disposal of PCBs
Definition of criteria to identify prioritize and remove from use equipment located in high risk areas in accordance with the provisions of the Stockholm Convention

comment.narrative: There is not a protocol and criteria established for the identifying and defining of priorities for equipment management in high risk areas
Equipment inventory and program for the removal of PCB contaminated equipment from high risk zones has been carried out

Up to date there are 13 companies located in the not Interconnected Zone NIZ that have been registered as PCB holders and who are actively participating in the national inventory reporting of 279 units
An additional 9 companies will participate in the NIZ pilot related on marking and identification of equipment under the project GRANT signed during the period 20142015 with CIDET

description.narrative: Establishment of guidelines and standards for the environmentally sound management of PCBs oil and contaminated equipment during maintenance of equipment transportation storage and disposal including occupational health and safety issues published and distributed

comment.narrative: There is a manual for PCB management as well as norms that establish the basic principles for proper environmentally sound management
Technical criteria for the maintenance of equipment with dielectric oils established

There is also an identification and description document of good practices for equipment maintenance with such document a diagnostic process was developed in 20 companies in the sector These documents will be included in the Manual for Sound Management of PCBs

description.narrative: Identification analysis inventory and environmentally sound management of PCBs in NonInterconnected Areas ZNI

comment.narrative: In the areas that are not interconnected ZNI to the national electricity network there has not been an inventory done for PCB equipment and oils Some of these equipments are found in high risk zones ecological protected zones forest reserves or vulnerable populations
Technical Assistance for the energy service providers in the ZNI for the identification of equipment and the compliance with Resolution 0222 of 2011 carried out

Up to June 2015 6 training and activities were held aimed at companies located in the not interconnected zones NIZ 2 of these sessions were conducted in the reporting period 20142015
During the period 2014 2015 a pilot program was formulated on marking and identification of equipment located in the noninterconnected zone
In December 2015 the implementation of that pilot program will be launched with the participation of 9 companies in the NIZ

description.narrative: Information system operating to consolidate disseminate and update in an orderly and periodic manner the data related to the inventory and management of PCBs in the country

comment.narrative: The IDEAM has a tool to register and update the inventory of the amount of PCBs eliminated The PCB generators must keep the information up to date using electronic means
Information platform to manage PCBs established and updated

With financial support provided by the project maintenance and strengthening of the National PCB Inventory and information system continues lead by IDEAM
As of April 30 2015 the PCB information system showed that 840 owners of equipment and waste are registered and active These owners have reported about 430000 pieces of PCB containing equipment containing dielectric oil
Of these 840 owners 138 were registered during this reporting period 20142015

description.narrative: National training program on the new standards guidelines and regulations for stakeholders involved in the handling of PCBs maintenance companies junk yards and recycling plants large consumers and industries retail consumers and industrial users among others

comment.narrative:
There is not a structured program for the training of personnel who do maintenance on PCB contaminated equipment and their proper management
The existing norm for PCBs establishes that for the sampling of PCB contaminated oils the personnel should be certified by the National Learning Service SENA
One program developed for the training and certifying of qualifications for technicians and operations personnel that do sampling of dielectric oils in equipment and also do maintenance

Up to June 30 2105 there are a total of 229 SENA certified technicians on sampling for determination of PCB in dielectric oils of the 229 certified to date 100 technicians were certified during the period 20142015

description.narrative: Number of authorized operators for the management of equipment or oils containing PCBs increased

comment.narrative: Some of the electrical companies have storage capacity for PCB contaminated equipment and oils in an environmentally safe manner especially those that are the largest generators commercializers and distributors There are four companies that have storage capacity for PCB contaminated equipment and oils and which have environmental license from the corresponding authority
An assessment to define the needs for storage packing and transport of PCB contaminated equipment and wastes carried out
A report was developed on current storage packaging and transportation practices for PCBs identified areas that need strengthening for authorized waste managers

description.narrative: Number of public and private laboratories strengthened for sampling and analysis of PCBs and other persistent pollutants in different matrices oil water soil air food blood and breast milk

comment.narrative: There are approximately 10 private laboratories that have PCB analysis capacity as well as the laboratories from the Universities and research centers that can be strengthened for PCB analysis Universidad de Antioquia Universidad National Universidad del Valle and the Universidad de Cartagena
A program of technical assistance for 10 laboratories to validate the analytical methods to identify PCBs in different matrices has been developed

During the reporting period the project has performed a Intercalibration exercise between national laboratories
Currently 20 laboratories 200 of the target have participated in activities of technical assistance funded by the project

description.narrative: Other stakeholders besides the electricity sector that have existing stocks of equipment andor materials contaminated with PCBs with content exceeding 50 ppm have been identified and included in national inventory

comment.narrative: The Regulation 222 established a series of criteria for the identifying labeling and characterizing of PCB wastes There is a PCB generator register which is administered by IDEAM All generators of PCBs must report their stocks to this entity
A demonstration project to identify the different equipment owners of the generation distribution commercializing and distribution energy companies developed
During the period 2014 2015 a pilot project was formulated to educate PCB owners part of the EPSA SA ESP company network located in the municipality of Buenaventura Valle del Cauca

description.narrative: PCB contaminated sites identified guidelines and action plan proposed

comment.narrative: There is not a protocol and criteria established for the identifying and managing of PCB contaminated sites
Action plan for the environmental authorities to start an identification of contaminated sites program created
Currently there has been a list compiled of companies and zones that will be prioritized for the identification of contaminated sites by regional environmental authorities

description.narrative: PCBs in highrisk food are monitored

comment.narrative: The Ministry of Health and Social Protection has plans to issue a norm to regulate food contaminants which includes to set limits on PCBs
A monitoring program on PCB in high risk food eg fish milk has been created
A draft agreement for the development of a monitoring program for PCB in fish products between the Ministry of Environment and the National Institute of Food and Drug INVIMA was formulated

description.narrative: Environmentally sound management and disposal of PCBs through demonstration pilot project
Agreements with PCB holders andor waste managers to demonstrate the operation maintenance disposal and storage of PCBs in accordance with new standards rules and regulations established

comment.narrative: During equipment maintenance transformers cross contamination can occur

One training program carried out with 15 maintenance companies that work with equipment that has dielectric fluids and company personnel in the electricity sector so that they are made aware of the criteria established in the Resolution 222 of 2011 This will avoid cross contamination and implement environmentally sound management of PCBs
The draft guide for good practices in maintenance is being validated by a technical committee made up of delegates from seven companies

description.narrative: Management and disposal of as much of the PCB contaminated equipment as possible that is located in high priority areas identified in the country

comment.narrative: The electrical service companies that are in the non connected zones in many cases are located in zones that are vulnerable from the ecological and social point of view
PCB contaminated equipment located in the NonInterconnected Areas that are considered to be high environmental and ecological sensitivity removed and eliminated
During the period 20142015 the terms of reference for the bidding process of removal and disposal of PCB equipment were prepared

description.narrative: Technical and environmental feasibility for each one of the technological alternatives proved and the lessons learned for their replication

comment.narrative: The demonstrative pilot projects will have the involvement of the environmental authorities PCB generators treatment companies in order to guarantee that the projects can be replicated
Technical and environmental evaluation for each of the proven alternatives establishing lessons learned and their publication

The final report for washing waste equipment is ready For the other demonstration projects the final results will be incorporated in the same report including lessons learned and opportunities for replication

description.narrative: Monitoring adaptive feedback outreach and evaluation
Number of high quality monitoring and evaluation documents prepared during project implementation

comment.narrative: No documents in baseline situation
4 Quarterly Operational Reports submitted to UNDP each year
Quarterly reports were submitted to UNDP accordance with the requirements of the institution

description.narrative: Strengthening the legal administrative and regulatory framework for the sound management of PCBs
A norm for dangerous waste management which includes PCB treatment

comment.narrative:
There has been a new regulation Resolution 222 for the PCB Management in Colombia that needs to be implemented
There is not a norm that regulates the treatment and elimination of PCB wastes
A legally binding norm or technical regulation for the treatment of PCBs issued

A draft of amendment of the PCBs regulation Resolution 222 was formulated and put into public consultation during this reporting period
The Ministry of Environment continues by consulting national and international experts the process of issuing the Regulation for Thermal Treatment of Hazardous Waste
The Ministry will incorporate the results of the PCB burn tests in particular technical and safety requirements
This regulation is expected to be completed and in public consult by 2016

description.narrative: Economic or financial instrument evaluated for the promotion of PCB management

comment.narrative:
There are fiscal exceptions for investments in PCB environmentally sound management
There are credit lines available with nonrefundable funding for companies that invest in issues such as quality control and environmental management
Evaluation of feasibility of applying economic financial or market instruments to promote environmentally sound management and disposal of PCBs completed
100 of the target was achieved The final report analyzing the feasibility and implementation of economic instruments related to PCB management activities has been published

description.narrative: Guidelines or a document which orient the work of commerce authorities in the control of importation and exportation of equipment and waste with PCBs

comment.narrative: There is no existing protocol for the control of importing and exporting of PCB contaminated equipment and waste at the ports and border crossings
Guideline or instrument published so that the customs authorities the police and other commercial authorities can control the importation and exportation of PCB contaminated equipment and wastes

A draft document Guidelines for the Control of ImportExport of PCB contaminated Equipment and Waste aimed at foreign trade authorities is available It is currently under going its validation by relevant authorities
There was also a process with foreign trade authorities for the characterization of control processes implemented the last four years in imports related to transformers that may contain PCB

description.narrative: Guidelines or a document which orient the work of health authorities in controlling population exposure to PCBs

comment.narrative: The health authorities have no programme established to evaluate PCB incidence in impacted populations
Guidelines for the health authorities to formulate controls for PCB exposure have been established

As of June 30 2015 there is a signed agreement with the National Institute of Health NIH for the development of epidemiological surveillance protocols and their application during next period 2015 2016 for a sample group of people potentially exposed to PCB

description.narrative: Labeling strategy for the identification of PCBs in equipment in use and out of use implemented in companies in the electricity sector

comment.narrative: The Colombian norm for PCB management establishes that the equipment that could have PCBs transformers and capacitors should be identified and labeled Currently only a limited number of equipment have been labeled regarding PCB content
Development of a demonstration project with the equipment owners that have PCBs for the labeling of equipment using the different available alternatives

During the reporting period 2014 2015 a project for the identification and marking of PCB equipment owned companies that provide services in a not interconnected Zone was prepared and financed by the project through a GRANT developed by CIDET
Currently 15 companies in the power sector are working on activities to identify and mark PCB containing equipment
During the reporting period the project finished a guidance document summarizing available alternatives for marking equipment

description.narrative: Personnel from the environmental health and customs authorities are trained for the implementation of the existing norms issued for PCB management including controlling PCBs in body fluids and food and import control system for electrical equipment transformers capacitors and dielectric oils

comment.narrative: The Ministry of Environment and Sustainable Development in December 2011 issued a guideline on the management of PCBs which has established a number of responsibilities for generators of this waste
Eight workshops or training sessions with officials from the environmental authorities to present the existing norm and the norm or regulation for PCB treatment

Up to June 20 2015 11 workshops only for environmental authorities were conducted 137 of the target 4 were held during 20142015 period 24 officials of environmental authorities were trained during the current reporting period
The workshops included the main aspects of the regulations governing the management of PCB Resolution 222 of 2011
It is expected that through this training approach authorities will become aware of the technical and management aspects involved in PCB management

title.narrative: Plan Nacional de Biodiversidad Colombia NBSAP

description.narrative: Plan Nacional de Biodiversidad para apoyar la implementación del Plan Estratégico del CDB 2011-2020 en Colombia

Este proyecto forma parte de la segunda generación de las actividades habilitantes a la biodiversidad (BD EA) bajo el FMAM. Colombia es parte del Convenio sobre la Diversidad Biológica (CDB) desde 1994
independent political entity
Environment - policy, planning and administration

Inclusión de orientaciones y metas para la gestión integral de biodiversidad y los servicios ecosistémicos en los siguientes marcos de planificación sectorial: Agricultura - pesca Minería Energía Turismo, comercio, viajes y transporte Petróleo-combustible Planificación territorial Agua
La inclusión de las orientaciones y metas para la gestión integral de biodiversidad y los servicios ecosistémicos dentro de los siguientes marcos políticos, normativos o instrumentales: Instrumentos de planificación y ordenamiento territorial Reducción de la pobreza Desarrollo rural y medios de subsistencia Seguridad alimentaria Comunidades locales (Pueblos indígenas, afrodescendientes y campesinos) Cambio Climático Población y planificación urbana Atención sanitaria, incluyendo la medicina tradicional

comment.narrative: Actualmente se cuentan con 6 Agendas interministeriales firmadas (transporte, agricultura, mincomercio, mindefensa, minas, salud). Las cuales deben ser fortalecidas para que incorporen orientaciones y metas de gestión integral de biodiversidad y los servicios ecosistémicos Los marcos políticos, normativos e instrumentales han tenido una mirada sectorial y temática y hacer falta incorporar explícitamente los abordajes y alcances en cuanto a sus nexos con la biodiversidad y los servicios ecosistémicos

Metas definidas para el 2020 para la gestión integral de la biodiversidad y los servicios ecosistémicos, que se articulan a instrumentos de política y gestión de sectores productivos y de planeación nacional.

• Documento de análisis de las metas Aichi para Colombia que identifica prioridades para cada meta, contiene insumos para definir indicadores, contexto de la meta a nivel nacional y posibles riesgos de cumplimiento. • Propuesta de documento del plan de acción entregada por IAvH a MADS y PNUD el cual incluye metas e indicadores para el 2020. • Estrategia de retroalimentación del Plan de Acción mediante desarrollo de TIC - Plataforma virtual

1. Metas definidas para el 2025 y 2030 para la gestión integral de la biodiversidad y los servicios ecosistémicos, que se articulan a instrumentos de política y gestión de sectores productivos y de planeación nacional. 2. Plataforma virtual de retroalimentación del Plan de acción implementada.

1. Plan de acción de biodiversidad • Se cuenta con análisis comparativo de las metas Aichi frente al plan de acción de biodiversidad. • Se realizó evento de lanzamiento de alto nivel, con presencia del ministro de ambiente, gerentes de gremios y sectores productivos, directivas de entidades académicas y de investigación, organizaciones de la sociedad civil de amplia trayectoria en gestión de la biodiversidad. • Plan de acción de Biodiversidad con metas e indicadores para el 2020, diseñado, editado y en proceso de impresión para su divulgación a actores relevantes, con tiraje de 200 ejemplares en inglés y 600 en español. El cual también está disponible en versión impresa. 1. Mecanismo de facilitación de información en biodiversidad CHM: • Se diseñó un micro site en la página del IAVH y puso en operación la plataforma virtual, aplicando los estándares de desarrollo del Instituto. El sistema se diseñó para realizar adición de imágenes, textos, con vínculos y herramientas externas, y menú para la generación y modificación de usuarios. • Se realizó capacitación en el uso del mecanismo de facilitación de información en biodiversidad con actores relevantes para la gestión de biodiversidad y se realizó seminario web con 4 sesiones, para que las partes interesadas pudieran remitir sus interrogantes y sugerencias, a las cuales se dio respuesta en las sesiones del seminario.

description.narrative: Desarrollo de las capacidades locales como estrategia para la reducción de riesgos tecnológicos y su incorporación en la planificación territorial
The IRRF is UNDP’s results framework to monitor and report on its achievements against the Strategic Plan 2014-2017. UNDP publishes country level IRRF results that UNDP’s projects contributed to
